title: Demographics
text: This page contains tables of baseline demographic characteristics for the 442 unique Link2Care participants. First, the statistics are presented below for all participants overall. Then, there are presented by randomization arm â€“ Usual Care Management (UCM), Usual Care Management + Smart Phone (UCM+SM), and Link2Care (L2C).

Overall
Demographic characteristics of the 442 Link2Care participants overall.

title: Overview
text:
This website contains multiple web-based tables of baseline descriptive statistics for (nearly) every survey data variable collected as part of the Link2Care project. For more information about the Link2Care project, please see the primary public repository at: https://github.com/brad-cannell/link2care_public.
The data for these tables is currently housed at UTHealth-Houston on the Link2Care SharePoint site. Contact Brad Cannell at Michael.B.Cannell@uth.tmc.edu if you have questions about accessing the data.

Administrative Information



Last updated:
2023-08-11
The date the tables on this website were last updated.


Source data:
combined_participant_data.rds
The name of the dataset used to create the tables on this website.


Source data path:
../Participant Data/R Data/
The path to the source data.


Source data size:
9.3 Mb
The size of the source data.


Source data row count:
849
The source data used to create the tables on this website includes data collected a visit 1 and visit 2 only.


Source data column count:
1,299
The number of columns/variables currently contained in the source data.


Count of participants:
442
The number of unique participants in the source data.


Count of UCM participants:
137
The number of unique participants in the source data who were in the usual care management arm of the Link2Care study.


Count of UCM+SP participants:
136
The number of unique participants in the source data who were in the usual care management plus smart phone arm of the Link2Care study.


Count of L2C participants:
134
The number of unique participants in the source data who were in the Link2Care arm of the Link2Care study.


Codebook:
link
Link to download the most current codebook for the source data.
